title-group.article-title: Ecology and Economics: in Search of Unity

permissions.copyright-statement: © Department of Plant Taxonomy and Ecology, ELTE

abstract.p: Economics, in its present form, is immanently counter-ecological, since it justifies the self-interest behaviour of economic actors and fully disregards ecological values such as diversity, complexity and stability of ecosysyterns. This short paper tries to trace some historical turning points of both ecology and economics during a long and tedious search of a more consistent unity. An ecologically sound economics is possible if and only if natural ecosystems are considered as functional entities valuable in and for themselves in the process of economizing.
